articles.description: Jannik Sinner says he cannot accept his progress to the Wimbledon quarter-finals  "as a win" following Grigor Dimitrov's injury heartbreak.
articles.title: Wimbledon 2025: Jannik Sinner says progress 'not a win' after Grigor Dimitrov injury

articles.description: South Africa’s Wiaan Mulder declares on 367 not out, passing up the opportunity to break Brian Lara’s record for the highest individual score in a Test innings.
articles.title: Wiaan Mulder declares 33 short of Brian Lara's iconic Test innings record of 400

articles.description: The umpire who officiated the match at the centre of Sunday's electronic line-calling controversy at Wimbledon is "having a rest day".
articles.title: Wimbledon 2025: Umpire Nico Helwerth, from the line-calling controversy match, 'having rest day'

articles.description: In some ways the purest form of the Champions League starts this week - with 28 champions starting in the first qualifying round.
articles.title: Champions League first qualifying round: The long road to Budapest begins

articles.description: Spain have laid down a marker at Euro 2025 with 11 goals in two games - but what makes them so good, and do they have weaknesses?
articles.title: Euro 2025: Spain 'the team to beat' - but what makes them good and do they have weaknesses?

articles.description: Novak Djokovic battles back from a challenging start to overcome an inspired Alex de Minaur and reach the Wimbledon quarter-finals.
articles.title: Wimbledon 2025 results: Novak Djokovic battles past Alex de Minaur to reach quarter-finals

articles.description: Luka Modric will join AC Milan after Real Madrid's Club World Cup campaign, the Serie A club's manager Massimiliano Allegri confirms.
articles.title: Luka Modric: Manager Massimiliano Allegri confirms Croatia midfielder to join AC Milan from Real Madrid

articles.description: Indiana Pacers superstar Tyrese Haliburton will miss the 2025-26 NBA season after having surgery to repair a torn right Achilles tendon.
articles.title: Tyrese Haliburton: Injured Indiana Pacers superstar to miss 2025-26 NBA season

articles.description: Technology editor Zoe Kleinman explores the tensions between between humans and machines that were encapsulated at Wimbledon.
articles.title: Why don't we trust technology in sport?

articles.description: Thiago Silva, 40, will face his former side Chelsea in Tuesday's Club World Cup semi-final. BBC Sport looks at how he defied the odds to reach the top.
articles.title: Chelsea v Fluminense: How monster Thiago Silva is inspiring Brazilians in Club World Cup
